content: named for the snowy mont valin in the saguenay region of québec this reversible brioche cowl is knit in the round beginning with a few row of garter before starting the brioche stitch in the main color the second contrast color is introduced and the cowl continues in two-color brioche the two colors are later swapped around syncopation to produce another color effect before returning to single color brioche and another sequence of garter before bind-off the finished cowl measures 9 high by 24 circumference this pattern was used to teach beginner brioche in the round
